table.name: [dbo].[PhotoObj]
table.summary: The main PhotoObj table for the RC3 catalog
table.remarks: The main PhotoObj table for the RC3 catalog

column.name: [name]
column.summary: Primary name

column.name: [aliases]
column.summary: Other names

column.name: [PGC_name]
column.summary: PGC (Paturel et al. 1989a,b) designation

column.name: [ra]
column.summary: Right Ascension (J2000)

column.name: [dec]
column.summary: Declination (J2000)

column.name: [cx]
column.summary: cartesian x coordinate

column.name: [cy]
column.summary: cartesian y coordinate

column.name: [cz]
column.summary: cartesian z coordinate

column.name: [htmid]
column.summary: htmid for spatial search

column.name: [zoneid]
column.summary: zoneid for spatial search

column.name: [good_position]
column.summary: The values of ra/dec are good to 0.1 sec time, 1 asec (otherwise, 0.1 min time, 1 amin)

column.name: [galactic_l]
column.summary: Galactic longitude in the IAU 1958 system (Blaauw et al. 1960); good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: [galactic_b]
column.summary: Galactic latitude in the IAU 1958 system (Blaauw et al. 1960); good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: [superGalactic_l]
column.summary: Supergalactic longitude in the RC2 system; good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: [superGalactic_b]
column.summary: Supergalactic latitude in the RC2 system; good to 0.01 degrees

column.name: [PosAngle]
column.summary: position angle, measured in degrees from north through east (all p.a. < 180 degrees), taken when available from UGC, ESO, and ESGC (and in a few cases from HI data).

column.name: [rc2_type]
column.summary: mean revised morphological type in the RC2 system, coded as in RC2

column.name: [rc2_typeSource]
column.summary: Sources of revised morphological type estimate

column.name: [T_type]
column.summary: Mean numerical index of stage along the Hubble sequence in the RC2 system

column.name: [T_typeErr]
column.summary: Error in T_type

column.name: [LC_rc2]
column.summary: Mean numerical luminosity class in the RC2 system

column.name: [LC_rc2Err]
column.summary: Error in LC_rc2

column.name: [n_L]
column.summary: Number of luminosity class estimates

column.name: [B_T]
column.summary: Total (asymptotic) magnitude in the B system, derived by extrapolation from photoelectric aperture-magnitude data, B_T^A, and from surface photometry with photoelectric zero point, B_T^S

column.name: [B_TErr]
column.summary: Error in B_T

column.name: [B_Tsource]
column.summary: M when B_T is the weighted mean of B_T^A and B_T^S; V when B_T is a V-band magnitude rather than a B-band magnitude; v when the nucleus of the galaxy is variable; * when deriving B_T^A would have required an extrapolation in excess of 0.75 mag.

column.name: [B_T0]
column.summary: total ``face-on'' magnitude corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

column.name: [M_B]
column.summary: Photographic magnitude from Ames (1930), Shapley and Ames (1932), CGCG, Buta and Corwin (1986), and/or Lauberts and Valentijn (1989) reduced to the B_T system

column.name: [M_BErr]
column.summary: Error in M_B

column.name: [M_FIR]
column.summary: Far-infrared magnitude calculated from M_FIR = - 20.0 - 2.5 log_10(FIR), where FIR is the far infrared continuum flux measured at 60 and 100 microns as listed in the IRAS Point Source Catalog (1987). For galaxies larger than 8 arcmin in RC2 and for the Virgo cluster area, resolved by the IRAS beam, integrated fluxes are taken from Rice et al. (1988) or Helou et al. (1988)

column.name: [M_21cm]
column.summary: 21-cm emission line magnitude, and its mean error, defined by m_21 = 21.6 - 2.5 log(S_H), where S_H is the measured neutral hydrogen flux density in units of 10^-24 W/m^2

column.name: [M_21cmErr]
column.summary: Error in M_21cm

column.name: [BV_T]
column.summary: Total (asymptotic) color index in the Johnson B-V system, derived by extrapolation from photoelectric color-aperture data, and/or from surface photometry with photoelectric zero point

column.name: [BV_TErr]
column.summary: Error in BV_T

column.name: [BV_T0]
column.summary: Total B-V color index corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

column.name: [BV_e]
column.summary: Mean B-V color index within the effective aperture A_e, derived by interpolation from photoelectric color-aperture data

column.name: [BV_eErr]
column.summary: Error in BV_e

column.name: [UB_T]
column.summary: Total (asymptotic) color index in the Johnson U-B system, derived by extrapolation from photoelectric color-aperture data, and/or from surface photometry with photoelectric zero point

column.name: [UB_TErr]
column.summary: Error in UB_T

column.name: [UB_T0]
column.summary: Total U-B color index corrected for Galactic and internal extinction, and for redshift

column.name: [UB_e]
column.summary: Mean U-B color index, and its mean error, within the effective aperture A_e, derived by interpolation from photoelectric color-aperture data

column.name: [UB_eErr]
column.summary: Error in UB_e

column.name: [lgD_25]
column.summary: mean decimal logarithm of the apparent major isophotal diameter measured at or reduced to surface brightness level mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2

column.name: [lgD_25Err]
column.summary: Error in lgD_25

column.name: [lgD_0]
column.summary: decimal logarithm of the isophotal major diameter corrected to ``face-on'' (inclination = 0 degrees), and corrected for Galactic extinction to A_g = 0, but not for redshift

column.name: [lgR_25]
column.summary: Mean decimal logarithm of the ratio of the major isophotal diameter, D_25, to the minor isophotal diameter, d_25, measured at or reduced to the surface brightness level mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2

column.name: [lgR_25Err]
column.summary: Error in lgR_25

column.name: [logA_e]
column.summary: Decimal logarithm of the apparent diameter (in 0.1 arcmin) of the ``effective aperture,'' the circle centered on the nucleus within which one-half of the total B-band flux is emitted

column.name: [logA_eErr]
column.summary: Error in logA_e

column.name: [m_e]
column.summary: mean B-band surface brightness in magnitudes per square arcmin (B-mag/arcmin^2) within the effective aperture A_e, as given by the relation m'_e = B_T + 0.75 + 5logA_e - 5.26. m'_e is statistically related to the effective mean surface brightness, mu'_e (RC2, p. 31; Olson and de Vaucouleurs 1981), with which it coincides when log R = 0 (i = 0 degrees)

column.name: [m_eErr]
column.summary: Error in m_e

column.name: [m_25]
column.summary: m'_25 = the mean surface brightness in B-mag/arcmin^2 within the mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2 elliptical isophote of major axis D_25 and axis ratio R_25, defined as in RC2 (Equation 21) by: m'_25 = B_T + Delta m_25 + 5 logD_25 - 2.5 logR_25 - - 5.26, where Delta m_25 = 2.5 log(L_T/L_D_25) = B_25 - B_T is the magnitude increment contributed by the outer regions of a galaxy fainter than mu_B = 25.0 B-mag/arcsec^2

column.name: [m_25Err]
column.summary: Error in m_25

column.name: [A_B]
column.summary: Galactic extinction in B-band magnitudes, calculated following Burstein and Heiles (1978a,b, 1982, 1984)

column.name: [A_HI_self]
column.summary: HI line self-absorption in magnitudes (for correction to face-on), calculated from logR and T >= 1

column.name: [A_B_int]
column.summary: internal extinction in B-band magnitudes (for correction to face-on), calculated from logR and T

column.name: [W_20]
column.summary: Neutral hydrogen line full width measured at the 20% level (I_20/I_max)

column.name: [W_20Err]
column.summary: Error in W_20

column.name: [W_50]
column.summary: Neutral hydrogen line full width measured at the 50% level (I_50/I_max)

column.name: [W_50Err]
column.summary: Error in W_50

column.name: [HI]
column.summary: corrected neutral hydrogen index, which is the difference m_21^0 - B_T^0 between the corrected (face-on) 21-cm emission line magnitude and the similarly corrected magnitude in the B_T system. N.n. Since m_21 and B_T are provided in this table, there is no need to list the uncorrected index.

column.name: [V_21cm]
column.summary: Mean heliocentric radial velocity, and its mean error, in km/s derived from neutral hydrogen observations

column.name: [V_21cmErr]
column.summary: Error in V_21cm

column.name: [V_opt]
column.summary: mean heliocentric radial velocity, and its mean error, in km/s derived from optical observations

column.name: [V_optErr]
column.summary: Error in V_opt

column.name: [V_GSR]
column.summary: weighted mean of the neutral hydrogen and optical velocities, corrected to the ``Galactic standard of rest

column.name: [V_3K]
column.summary: weighted mean velocity corrected to the reference frame defined by the 3 K microwave background radiation

column.name: [objId]
column.summary: the main primary key
